choices.name: Get started with research for your New Mexico ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for New Mexico ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for New Mexico research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic New Mexico research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic New Mexico Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for New Mexico ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step New Mexico Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for New Mexico research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—New Mexico Resources
    ☆ AC—New Mexico State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the New Mexico Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—New Mexico Record Finder

    5. Additional Records
    1. Sites: Explore a variety of records on the New Mexico Genealogical Society site.
    2. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    3. Explore a variety of records on the AmericanStatesFreeAncestry site.
    4. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    5. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    6. Learn about colonial records in New Mexico.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Records of New Mexico


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in New Mexico in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for New Mexico

    2. Explore the African American Gateway for New Mexico.
    3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in New Mexico in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of New Mexico


Additional Records
  1. Sites: Explore a variety of records on the New Mexico Genealogical Society site.
  2. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  3. Explore a variety of records on the AmericanStatesFreeAncestry site.
  4. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  5. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  6. Learn about colonial records in New Mexico.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Records of New Mexico

Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in New Mexico in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for New Mexico

  2. Explore the African American Gateway for New Mexico.
  3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in New Mexico in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of New Mexico

choices.name: Learn about New Mexico archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about New Mexico archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New Mexico Archives and Libraries
    ☆ New_Mexico State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for New Mexico.
  3. Explore New Mexico Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for New Mexico genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  5. Search for ☆free online books on New Mexico research on the FamilySearch site.
  6. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find New Mexico ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about New Mexico city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New Mexico Directories

  2. Sites: Explore New Mexico city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore New Mexico city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore New Mexico ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for New Mexico city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

New Mexico Death Records

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or New Mexico County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for New Mexico.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the New Mexico Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the New_Mexico Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the New_Mexico Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for New Mexico.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about New Mexico research.
  2. Explore the New Mexico research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about New Mexico research.

choices.name: Learn about New Mexico genealogy societies.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in New Mexico in this FamilySearch Wiki article. ☆

    FS—Wiki: New Mexico Societies

  2. Explore the New Mexico Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Albuquerque Genealogical Society site.
  4. Explore New Mexico genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in New Mexico.
